website_summaries.verdict: The perfect budget option for a permanent grab bar unit in the bathroom. Takes little time to install and secure correctly.
pros: Heavy-duty construction and mounting will keep the grab bar safely secure when leaning or pulling on the surface
cons: Bar diameter is smaller than other grab bars available

customer_reviews.title: ... stainless steel grab bar shower handle has a very good quality materials
customer_reviews.text: This heavy duty shiny stainless steel grab bar shower handle has a very good quality materials. It surely gives safety protection when you go in and out of the shower. Comes with the hardware and easy to install. I totally agree about the positive reviews that people gave about this item. I like it. It was an Excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: J_nice17

customer_reviews.title: Versatile!
customer_reviews.text: Useful for older folks like me that need to hold on to something while taking off shoes. Beats leaving finger prints on the wall. Also makes a darned good towel rack. Not so good for doing chin ups.
customer_reviews.author: Frumious

customer_reviews.title: Hollow bar Solid value!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this for her parents to use as they are in need of assistance from time to time getting in and out of the shower. This bar is a cinch to install and comes with a variety of holes to allow you to fit just about any stud spacing. You may have to angle to bar to do this ( which is what I did ) but that actually can make it fit the natural "lay" of your hand. The covers twist in place to cover the mounts too. No setscrews to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Good price, quality and recommended by my physical/occupational therapist.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, especially for the price. It also works well for larger hands. I didn't notice that there was a knurled/peened version until after the smooth version arrived. I don't know if that makes that much of a difference when wet or not. Something to consider before buying. Due to space restrictions (1.5"), I also had to get another brand for outside the shower that had a smaller mounting footprint. It works fine but the Franklin Brass one is so much nicer, better quality and was actually cheaper. It just needs a 3" mounting area, 1.5" too big. Also bought the 12" version. This review applies to that one also.Same product, different size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Don

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY AND FUNCTION AS EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a couple of grab bars from Home Depot but the sizing was not correct and to get a 16 inch grab bar from HD cost $40+ I needed two for my mother in law as she is very unsteady on her feet. The two from Amazon showed up as promised and I went to work with the installation. Just follow the directions and use a stud finder, drill a pilot hole and install two screws on the top and bottom. Be sure not to over tighten as the phillips head on the screen will crap out and as I found, require you to manually back out the 3 inch screw using pliers.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Keesee

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: Added #2 these to my newly remodeled walk in shower since I don't have good balance and am handicap. They look beautiful and can double for washcloth or towel holders. My contractor added additional 2X4s support just to make sure these where really secure in the wall and would not pull out. This may not be necessary but I am heavyset and have an older home where the framing did not match the length of the bar measurements exactly. Just measure where your studs are to make sure these will not be in your hallow wall.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Lynn Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Well made and easy to install if you have the right tools and ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy to install if you have the right tools and your wall studs are on 16 inch centers. Need bubble level, drill with screwdriver and small bit. Good screws to ensure sufficient support for attachment. Only item was washer that covers flange that attaches to wall was difficult to get loose then couldn't get it to go back over the flange with out using a hammer and slightly change shape.
customer_reviews.author: shops for wife

customer_reviews.title: Solid bar and EZ install.
customer_reviews.text: This installed very easily with a drill, bits, level and a Phillips screwdriver. I also neede a stud finder to confirm the stud location in the wall. It made for a much safer bathroom use for my elderly mom. Good price point, but surprised it jumped up almost twice the price this week. Glad I found it for eleven dollars when I did. I purchased 2. One for each bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: zrtm

customer_reviews.title: Very safe
customer_reviews.text: These security grab bars (I bought two for next to the toilets) are sturdy, easy to clean. My physical therapist recommend I do this, but I was quoted some extraordinary price for a maintenance person to get them installed. Instead, I found them on Amazon for a good price and I am glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: None Name

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected. Just like you see in public spaces. Solid, smooth finish, and easily mounted, if you have a stud available. This one is quite long, which I wanted, because for some reason, there's a substantial drop from the height of our tub/shower floor, to the bathroom floor, and I mounted this one vertically, so we can hang on, as we step out, and try not to fall. I'm very happy with it, so far. (2 months-ish).
customer_reviews.author: KMTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice strong grab bar but the package should include better screws
customer_reviews.text: Franklin Brass should know better than to provide philllips head screws that need to go 2.5" into wall studs. The phillips drive is too sloppy and inadequate for the job. A square drive or hex drive or lag screw is needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Included screws are useless (strip so easily)
customer_reviews.text: Note: I installed this on a rock wall as an alternative hold. Frustrated when the screws stripped so easily and quickly I couldn't even unscrew them.... not a happy climber.
customer_reviews.author: Bugalydosh

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install and works fine
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to install and works well. It is built well and should support most any weight without problems. If you need one of these, this one is well built and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount and very secure
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in time but no wall anchors came with bar, screws came but no anchors. Just keep that in mind when ordering. Not a big enough deal to deduct a star, Ordered second one and arrived 2 days late. Product fine shipping terrible
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Good grab bars
customer_reviews.text: They work great. The only thing I would suggest is putting molly screws with it in case you can't find studs whe9you need to place then. Also the covers dont stay on, they keep sliding off. Other than that they are great.
customer_reviews.author: PeachieJ

customer_reviews.title: we were still able to install the bar and the end result was great. My grandma can finally get her independence back ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 94 year old grandmas shower in Dominican Republic. Even though her walls are made of concrete, we were still able to install the bar and the end result was great. My grandma can finally get her independence back thanks to this bar. No longer will she need someone to hold her in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: MidLife Introvert

customer_reviews.title: it is secure and strong grab bar
customer_reviews.text: it fits 16 inch center studs in the wall... another brand was only 14 inches ... this is better than sliced bread .. secure to wall with 2 1/2 inch screws....one thing when using the level one side had a very small tit facing up even when i turned it around maybe the tits could be on the same side not one up and one down makes it hard to level..... the tits lock the flange over the screws... and i used hex head screws they work better with my driver...
customer_reviews.author: Henry T

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a hollow wall mount. It only comes with screws. Total fraud by Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if you don't have studs to anchor too. This does not come with the hollow wall brackets as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... safety feature to a bathroom and these were the best alternative we could find and at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: We needed to add a safety feature to a bathroom and these were the best alternative we could find and at a reasonable price. They are definitely heavy duty and secure Hardware provided works great. We also use them for towel bars which basically hides the heavy duty look for some style.
customer_reviews.author: Karma

customer_reviews.title: Stabile bar - good diameter to hold onto
customer_reviews.text: These bars have a good diameter to hold onto. They were easy to install (yes, you need a drill with drillbits) and they work well! Glad I installed them in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Corsair174

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: I installed in my dad's shower and it works nice. I intentionally bought one that was 16 inches so I could put both ends into the studs. It holds solid even with one screw, but I put a second screw in each end for additional safety.
customer_reviews.author: Some Reveiwer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and made well
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and made well. Only drawback is getting the covers back on each mounting bracket. Had to fiddle with them a while and took a fair amount of force to finally get them to slip over the bracket. Description should include a note about being stud mounted which is the most desirable methods but the instructions give you an option for installing them between studs against the drywall. This bracket is a separate part that must be ordered or obtained before you can complete installation.
customer_reviews.author: S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT fit MOEN Magnetix series shower heads !!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently MOEN Magnetix units are not made to industry standard 1/2" fittings !! NOTE: ABOVE REVIEW IS NOT FOR GRAB BARS ! IT WAS FOR ANOTHER ITEM AND SOMEHOW GOT TRANSCRIBED TO THIS ITEM !!
customer_reviews.author: L. Votzmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable diameter for grasping
customer_reviews.text: These grabs do exactly what they promise to do. Both my husband and I have stability issues and must use walkers. Showering is risky business for the likes of us, so shower grabs become essential to assist with safety. These are a comfortable diameter for grasping and give us confidence in entering and exiting the shower. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LH16

customer_reviews.title: STURDY. NICE APPEARENCE.
customer_reviews.text: ROTATE THE TRIM RING TO THE BEST POSITION BEFORE SNAPPING IT ON. THE HOLE IS SLIGHTLY OFF CENTER AS NEEDED FOR AN EXACT FIT. FIND THE STUDS FOR THE NEEDED STRENGTH.
customer_reviews.author: NORTH ARKIE

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy shower support
customer_reviews.text: Drilled holes in shower wall to install this solid, very sturdy grab bar. My gait is unsteady and so I depend on it any time I'm in the shower. The unit is well made and relieves any concern I have about losing my balance.
customer_reviews.author: DrDave

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Grab Bar for my Shower!
customer_reviews.text: My husband installed the bar at the entry to our shower/tub in the bathroom. They are really nice looking and appear to be top quality stainless. Now I have some peace of mind that I won't fall because I have these support bars. Thanks seller.
customer_reviews.author: M. Uratani

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. In my situation, they were a bit difficult to install, but I think in many situations, they would be fairly easy to install. Depends on what you're installing them to.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Clontz

customer_reviews.title: Does Its Job
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar was pretty easy to install. We had to wax the screws to get them all the way into the studs because they are so long, but the bar is nice and sturdy. I took off one star because the finish looks a little cheap. Overall, satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Stable
customer_reviews.text: This bar is great. I've tried using the suction type bars. Not a fan. This would be more difficult to move but it isn't going anywhere unless you put it there.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Padgett

customer_reviews.title: Strong and great texture
customer_reviews.text: I ordered three bars total; two 18 inch and a 36 inch for my parents. I can't speak for the hardware, I had a handyman install them for us. What I can attest to is their sturdiness and the grip even with wet hands. If you're trying to choose between peened and satin, I'd go with peened. Satin is what you find in most accessible public bathrooms, but with a wet hand, I think peened gives that extra, needed friction to prevent slippage. My parents have been very complimentary about them and have had no problems with the diameter.
customer_reviews.author: MET

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: So so. Seems to be trending toward rust. Caps don't fit tightly. We use it outside the shower. Would not advise putting it in the shower. Water would collect behind caps.
customer_reviews.author: cybergeezer

customer_reviews.title: Great grab bar that serves its purpose!
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this grab bar except cleaning: you can see the fingerprints and dried water parks on it, but it’s not a big issue. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality . . . Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality Good Price. Easy to install and looks great. Replace some older designed handles with these and they look much more up to date. They worked for us.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Larson

customer_reviews.title: Franklin Brass 48" bar
customer_reviews.text: We went with the 48" bar cause the studs were on the corner of bath shower. It was easy to install and is very sturdy as long as you screw to studs.
customer_reviews.author: fchin3044

customer_reviews.title: Not all the needed parts are included
customer_reviews.text: In theory, this is an outstanding product. But some of the necessary parts for installing it are missing (by design), and thus not to be recommended.
customer_reviews.author: EtaoinShrdlu

customer_reviews.title: Great for after my hip replacement surgery!
customer_reviews.text: I recently had a hip replacement and needed a safety bar next to my shower. The 16 inch was perfect and is very solid. I actually use it for my towel as well being right next to the shower and easy to grab. Since i'm not very handy I did need to have a friend install it for me but it was no problem for him. Nine weeks later, I'm on the way to recovery but still using it daily.
customer_reviews.author: MJoy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality.
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with the solid feel and quality of this produce. Attached it to two studs behind a sheetrock wall with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Matrix

customer_reviews.title: Very solid
customer_reviews.text: Very solid unit gives a great grip for lots of weight; as long as you get at least 2 screws on each end directly into studs.
customer_reviews.author: MarksALot

customer_reviews.title: A Perfect Grab Bar!
customer_reviews.text: This Safety First Grab Bar met all of our needs perfectly. We needed a sturdy fixture for a small bathroom space, smart looking (love that stainless steel finish) along with being unobtrusive, easy to put in place into studs without the screws showing...and this met our criteria exactly. Most grab bars were way too large/long for our small space. And there's plenty of finger/hand room between the bar & the wall, yet does not protrude out too far. It's now in place and provides all the needed support we need. Amazon's reasonable price with prime shipping made it by far our best buy as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product.
customer_reviews.text: If your walls are 16” centers you want to get this. It’s sturdy and a must for that someone who needs the extra help.
customer_reviews.author: Kismet

customer_reviews.title: Stop accidents........
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy safety item. Very easy to install. I installed in guest bathroom with shower and tub for ease in and out of tub.Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene M. Geyer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for my wife who recently had leg surgery. Strong and sturdy product. Well built and reasonably easy to install. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Gives added stability where used. Placed one in shower and another by toilet to help disabled ability to function without assistance in bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer 13

customer_reviews.title: Strong and we’ll made.
customer_reviews.text: My husband permanently installed this. Love it. Strong hold. A life saver. Easy to grip and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Debby White

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well made
customer_reviews.text: These handles are solid and well made. Easy to install and they feel secure. Nice finish on them
customer_reviews.author: Suzan B.

customer_reviews.title: Grab bars are sturdy and reasonably easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions could have helped by suggesting how to find the studs needed to mount the grab bars. I had to drill small holes in the area above tiles to find them. The instructions should have provided this suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: John L Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for my mom who has separate steps in her house. She has balance issues, so we attached these to the door frames to give her something to hold onto. They work perfectly for this!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Smith

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This bar is anchored right to the wall studs. can withstand a tremendous amount of weight
customer_reviews.author: Paul Forkus Sr

customer_reviews.title: All stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my shower very sturdy and meets ada code All stainless steel brushed finished
customer_reviews.author: robert holder

customer_reviews.title: S/S mterial quality and desigh
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality stainless steel and design for professional appearance due to flange to hide screws. Easy installation on wood surfaces, however it is best to have a knowledgeable or professional person with tools/equipment for installation on concrete surfaces and/or drywall. Need fasteners pending type of fastening surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S. Taniguchi

customer_reviews.title: Well-made Product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Grab Bar after reading several reviews on Amazon. The Bar is well constructed and it was easy enough to install, following the manufacturer's instructions. I chose this over the suction-cup style mounted units because I've never had any suction-cup mounted item that didn't eventually become loose or fall off the wall, so I wouldn't trust one to stay attached with the weight of a (possibly falling) person hanging from it. It's ruggedly made and it looks good mounted on the wall to our shower.
customer_reviews.author: R. and D. Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: The hardware was worthless. If you buy this save time and go buy the screws from a real hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Stagner

customer_reviews.title: Grab Bar for post hip suregery
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to place in the toilet area after my wife's hip replacement surgery. Easy to install by myself. As other reviewers have commented, I would definitely drill the pilot holes a full i/32" larger that recommended in the installation paperwork and perhaps even 3/64" larger. I think it would be impossible to screw in at the the suggested size without stripping the screw head, even with waxing the screw for lubrication. After using the bar for a month, it is a quality product, extremely reasonably priced and is very securely in place
customer_reviews.author: HomerCo

customer_reviews.title: Nice item. Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and as described. Installed for mother in law and worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Phy

customer_reviews.title: Nice.
customer_reviews.text: Nice equipment at a fair price. The screws strip out pretty easily unless you have just the right bit.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy D. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: this is the best grab bar on the market........I have tried others.....the finish helps with it being non slippery for a person depending wholly on it for standing up and keeping balance
customer_reviews.author: N. Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Top notch quality!
customer_reviews.text: This grab bar is a work of art! It is beautifully made and includes six two inch screws that can affix this thing so an elephant can't move it. We use it as an aid for a step up from an entry way. Being of a certain age, it provides security as well as being attractively made.
customer_reviews.author: MacWiz

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and good quality, easy to install but a bit hard to insert the covers of the edges back on, they sometimes pop back off, if not, a 5 star all the way
customer_reviews.author: D. Afarian

customer_reviews.title: works as shipped if you have wood studs in the bathroom area
customer_reviews.text: good product. Would have given 5 stars if included the toggle bolts that i had to purchase separately. They ship with wood screws which couldn't work in my bathroom due to metal studs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: After measuring for stud support I mounted one of these on my bedroom wall for doing stretches in my exercise routine. I’m putting a lot of stress on it but feel totally secure. I mounted it with heavy duty hex drive construction screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are nice looking, strong
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these so far from the same manufacturer. I haven't tried one from any one else so I can't compare against those. They are nice looking, strong, and do the job once installed. The only issue I have had is getting the trim that covers the screws to lock in. I have always been successful at that, but usually have to mess with it a bit to get there.
customer_reviews.author: MJH

customer_reviews.title: 12" length is more $$
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice handle bar and when installed properly will work fine. I would have liked the 12" handle but, believe it or not, the 16" was a few $$'s less. Since we had room for this size, we went with this one. It's quite large in diameter but the finish isn't slippery. Most importantly - be sure to have it installed properly. The last thing you want is a elderly mom or dad relying on it in the bath tub and it pulls from the wall.
customer_reviews.author: S. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but testy to attach to tile and instructions leave a lot to be desired, especially when you don’t hit 2 studs. Really only need one, we determined.
customer_reviews.author: SherryQ

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: these are not suction cups, they use screws. Work great for the bathroom
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: studdly sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: a little tricky to line up with wall studs - but do-able.
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: getting old
customer_reviews.text: needed this in the shower. saved my butt from falling more than a few times !
customer_reviews.author: Grandma's Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Great grabs, affordable and does not detract from the bathrooms.
customer_reviews.text: The finish goes well with brushed nickel, and the price was a fraction of other brands.
customer_reviews.author: John Federer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fair price
customer_reviews.text: This has a brushed stainless finish and a possible of 6 screw hole mounting positions which is nice. The mounting screws are 2 1/2" and may hard to drive in without a good pilot hole. You may find it easier to replace these with 1 1/2" or 1 3/4" deck screws if you have them on hand. My only comment is the bar doesn't have a sandpaper stippled finish which might be a little safer.
customer_reviews.author: Al D

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Bought five and installed on a handicap home....they work great
customer_reviews.author: Dennis B.

customer_reviews.title: I feel more secure in the tub/shower now
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 to add around my new garden tub. Very sturdy bar, make sure you do not use less than 2 screws on each side, as the instructions says.
customer_reviews.author: aedored

customer_reviews.title: Grab bar
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made the stainless steel is all marked up from machining. Kept it and am using it. The marks don't show.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy NN

customer_reviews.title: would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: these are a very nice quality for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: Like_shopping_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality & stability.
customer_reviews.text: Great commercial quality grab bar. They are not flimsy at all. I wish the company would not put a warning sticker on the finished product. The sticker is warning you that using a chemical to clean the bar may mess the finish up. You need a chemical to get the glue from the sticker off.
customer_reviews.author: Medwar8

customer_reviews.title: Good bar; 16in is too short to slant.
customer_reviews.text: Got 16in bar, then Nurse recommended slanting it, so I had to get a 24in to hit the studs
customer_reviews.author: codercharles

customer_reviews.title: Screwed into a board that's attatched to the studs, ...
customer_reviews.text: Screwed into a board that's attatched to the studs, it can take a large portion of my 250lb weight. It hasn't loosened up at all which is quite impressive and feels very secure!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Banta

customer_reviews.title: These Prevent Us From Falling.
customer_reviews.text: Us crips, my wife and I, have a total of 5 of these throughout our apartment, and they are simply fantastic. If you have a problem maintaining your balance in your residence, particularly in your bathroom, don't go without these any longer. They may save your life.
customer_reviews.author: Oldieman

customer_reviews.title: Look great and are very
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been asking me to put up some bars in the shower for her to hang on. I was dreading doing it not sure how they would work. Well, these came and were put up in about an hour. Look great and are very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Mike S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with anchors or removable steel plate. but that also depends on how and what you are installing them to.
customer_reviews.author: CGia

customer_reviews.title: Nice bar. Well made. Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice grab bar. Not perfect, but attractive and strong for a very reasonable price. I installed it vertically in a dry location near a toilet to help someone with bad knees pull themselves forward and up. (see photo) A little fussy getting it to mount to standard 1 1/5" wide stud due to the flange hole locations (not adjustable) but putting the bar on a slight angle worked well and allowed screws to be on alternate sides for maximum stability. Oh, I found the recommended drill size to be way too small. I used a significantly larger drill to avoid stripping screw heads.
customer_reviews.author: RICKVOO

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Just have to find the stud. Works well when installed correctly. Looks nice too,
customer_reviews.author: J Kevin Paulsen

customer_reviews.title: Bar for support
customer_reviews.text: Needed this bar for support for my husband who had a stroke. Works great. Had problem installing but it was because my wall was not level.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Lee Keeble

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Great price and perfect for 16" OC stud installation. Scr3ews are perfect size but use 1/8" drill bit to pre-drill holes. (A little soap on threads helps immensely)
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Easy to install. For greatest safety, always locate and secure it to at least one stud.
customer_reviews.author: jeannez

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: We first tried a grab bar with suction cups but it just didn't stay put so we purchased this grab bar. It was easy to install and is extremely stable. It's just what we needed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great, looks good!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! I had to mount it outside my back door so I can climb into the house. I looks good and being stainless steel it should look good for quite a long time.
customer_reviews.author: R Wilson

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: It took about half an hour to install. Locate studs with a detector, then check with tiny nail to be sure. Drill pilot holes slightly smaller than the screws or you will never get them in. I had to oil the screws to make it easier after trying the first one and having to back it out. My studs are old and dry, green lumber might be easier. The bar is good looking and well made.
customer_reviews.author: R M Lathrop

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: very strong, nice color and easy to use, i placed it in the bathroom for my elderly parents and they love it
customer_reviews.author: Heshy

customer_reviews.title: These bars are great High quality
customer_reviews.text: These bars are great High quality, nice finish and easy to install I installed 5 in the bathroom for my parents
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Worked great and great price
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed hip surgery and knee surgery. These safety bars have been a great help to her. Also they were a super price. Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Rev Jarrett (the 1st)

customer_reviews.title: I didn't notice they are not knurled but have a pretty smooth surface so grip might be a problem with ...

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Was afraid to order on line and was very pleased when I received the bars. Just as good as the bars selling for way. Ore at Home Depot and Lowe's. Also, a good thing to know, unlike the bars in stores they are uniform to the spacing between studs in wall. Others would require additional hardware to install for stability.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Installs easy
customer_reviews.text: I have installed three of these around my house for my disabled spouse. They work great and are easy to install. I would recommend you make sure you screw them into studs. Do no use wall anchors

product_meta.title: Franklin Brass 5616 1-1/2-Inch x 16-Inch Concealed Mount Safety Bath and Shower Grab Bar, Stainless
product_meta.description:
Size:1.5 x 16 Inch| Color:Stainless SteelThe Franklin Brass 16” Concealed Mount Grab Bar provides leverage, support and stability for up to 500 pounds, exceeding ADA standards, while adding a decorative touch to your bathroom. With only 2-3 screws required for a secure mount, the five screw flange gives you installation flexibility to accommodate your individual grab bar mounting needs. The decorative flange cover fits securely over the grab bar flange, concealing the screws. Crafted from stainless steel for lasting quality and durability, and available the metallic, smooth and shiny Stainless Steel finish to coordinate beautifully with most bathroom finishes. Accidents can occur, but be ready before they happen. Make bathroom safety a part of your home décor. We’ve provided a suggested product placement guide and installation videos to get you started. Being safe is easier than you think.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Safety First bath ware provides the functional solution for one of the most accident-prone rooms in the house. Safety without sacrificing elegance in your bathroom.
feature_bullets: Safety meets sophistication with these heavy-duty grab bars that exceed ADA and ASTM standards while providing extra security in the bathroom
Able to support upto 500 pounds of pull force
Made of stainless steel for a lasting strength and quality. Multiple finishes and sizes available
Concealed mount allows you to cover any unsightly screw holes and continue a clean, sleek trend to your bath and shower
1-1/4" bar diameter allows enough space to easily grip bar for added support
